urls.title: B-lines | Shropshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: The B-Lines are a series of ‚Äòinsect pathways‚Äô running through our countryside and towns, along which we are restoring and creating a series of wildflower-rich habitat stepping stones. They link existing wildlife areas together, creating a network, like a railway, that will weave across the British landscape.

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids I'm sorry but to hell with ' voluntary ' grow a pair and use your enforcement powers! You're about as much use as a toothless tiger!  Clearly the tail is wagging the dog in your 'relationship' with Red! We the residents have had enough.... NOW ACT and stop dithering! @Cap_it_off

@EnvAgencyMids The residents of Newcastle-under-Lyme are let down by the @EnvAgency and @ClareDinnisEA once again. It‚Äôs taken national news coverage and pressure from palament to get any action and still Walley‚Äôs Quarry will be allowed to accept waste before issues are resolved @StinkStopthe

@EnvAgencyMids Meanwhile tonight excited children in Newcastle under Lyme are suffering. üëá why don‚Äôt you just stop @RedIndustries2 accepting the waste until you find out what exactly is going on! #stopthestink https://t.co/ifi4BkZRJA

Having symptoms day in day out is hell, we have no end in sight we feel hopeless prisoner in our homes that @RedIndustries2 have turned into gas chambers @EnvAgency letting it carry on we can‚Äôt take anymore give us our lives back #StopTheStink @Cap_it_off #fridaymorning https://t.co/m15jqoRGQN

My odour survey last night at 3.10am on the Galingale. What people are living with isn't fair or right, and clearly further capping off is required: the whole site if necessary @EnvAgencyMids #StopTheStink

urls.title: Invasive Species Week - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: It's Invasive Species Week! Throughout the week lots of events and activities will be taking place that people can take part in online or socially distanced. We know that many have been finding solace in nature over the last year, and we will be sharing some simple tips to help you protect the environment. Follow along at @InvasiveSp (external link) or #INNSweek to be added to the mailing list for updates. Take a look at all the activities and materials that have been released this week, and see a list of

tweets.text:
England is at risk of facing #WaterShortages by 2050 due to #ClimateChange and population growth.

We're working with water companies to tackle this challenge and protect our water supplies.

Find out how: https://t.co/3OsurzkVGO https://t.co/Lu2mHFgV6F

urls.title: Guest blog with David Dangerfield
urls.description: Director of Water, Land and Biodiversity at the Environment Agency, David Dangerfield, discusses the issues surrounding water resilience and how The National Framework for Water Resources is working with local and regional groups to address these issues.
